posts.post_content:
Probably the card I was most looking forward to.  
  
Haste and Flying that can swing for 6 damage, for 6 mana, is enough for me.  
  
Doubling my attacking force, re-triggering Attack triggers (like battalion), with the potential for more or even infinite combat turns, and all on the turn she comes in makes her almost unreal.  
  
And they threw on vigilance to boot.  
  
I love cards with a lot of inherent synergy, and they went ahead and made her into a little engine of destruction.
posts.html:
Probably the card I was most looking forward to.

Haste and Flying that can swing for 6 damage, for 6 mana, is enough for me.

Doubling my attacking force, re-triggering Attack triggers (like battalion), with the potential for more or even infinite combat turns, and all on the turn she comes in makes her almost unreal.

And they threw on vigilance to boot.

I love cards with a lot of inherent synergy, and they went ahead and made her into a little engine of destruction.

posts.post_content:
I can see this in EDH and I really like the mana curve. Imagine T5 [Nobilis of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nobilis of War) drop and this following next turn. Those creatures alone would do 20 dmg, with evasion, but if you are playing boros, you likley have a whole horde of creatures out, making this card all that much more brutal.  
Well desinged, as a finished and mana cost is pretty balanced, I'd say. She's not overpowered, but she sure is very strong.

posts.post_content:
Splash Blue, encode [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity) onto [Invisible Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Invisible Stalker). Swing, create a copy of Aurelia, killing the orginal. Swing with the copy (and the stalker). Create another copy, killing the first copy. Repeat until your oppononent dies.  
  
Great, it's not in effect yet, and the new legendary rule is already broken.

posts.post_content: I really like the Razia reference. Compared to her predecessor [Razia, Boros Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Razia, Boros Archangel) She makes up for the 6/3 Haste, Vigilance with her own 4/3 Insurrection. I love how being a mythic has made Legends so much more powerful. I kind of feel bad that all Razia got was a 3 damage redirection and cost 8 mana. EEk no wonder she didn't see much play. As far as Aurelia goes everything I want to say about her has already been said. In Limited pick her and bash in for the win, in Standard she is a late game monster who needs to be dealt with.
